Job Position: Warehouse Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Assist in receiving incoming shipments, verifying contents against purchase orders, and recording receipt of goods in inventory management systems.
	Inspect and check incoming goods for damage, discrepancies, or defects, reporting any issues to the warehouse manager and coordinating with vendors or suppliers for resolution.
	Perform physical inventory counts, cycle counts, and stock checks to ensure accuracy of inventory records and reconcile discrepancies between physical stock and system data.
	Prepare goods for storage or shipment, labeling, tagging, and categorizing items according to storage requirements, product type, and destination.
	Assist in organizing warehouse space, arranging shelves, racks, and storage areas to optimize space utilization, accessibility, and efficiency.
	Pick and pack orders for shipment, selecting items from inventory, assembling orders, and preparing them for dispatch, ensuring accuracy and timeliness of order fulfillment.
	Load and unload trucks, containers, or pallets using manual or powered equipment, such as forklifts, pallet jacks, or hand trucks, following safety procedures and handling guidelines.
	Maintain cleanliness and orderliness of the warehouse, sweeping floors, removing debris, and disposing of waste materials, ensuring compliance with safety and sanitation standards.
	Monitor inventory levels and stock replenishment needs, alerting warehouse manager of low stock levels, overstock situations, or potential stockouts to facilitate timely ordering and replenishment.
	Assist in inventory reconciliation and stock adjustments, documenting inventory movements, adjustments, and transfers in inventory management systems and maintaining accurate records.
	Prepare shipping documents, packing slips, and labels for outgoing shipments, ensuring compliance with shipping regulations, customer requirements, and documentation standards.
	Coordinate with logistics providers, carriers, and freight forwarders to schedule pickups, deliveries, and transportation of goods, tracking shipments and resolving logistics issues as needed.
	Assist in conducting regular safety inspections, equipment checks, and preventive maintenance activities on warehouse equipment, reporting any defects or malfunctions for repair.
	Provide support to warehouse staff and assist in training new hires on warehouse procedures, safety protocols, and equipment operation.
	Follow standard operating procedures (SOPs), work instructions, and company policies governing warehouse operations, ensuring compliance with quality standards and regulatory requirements.


Method of Application&nbsp;

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Officer
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Assist in receiving incoming shipments, verifying contents against purchase orders, and recording receipt of goods in inventory management systems.
	Inspect and check incoming goods for damage, discrepancies, or defects, reporting any issues to the warehouse manager and coordinating with vendors or suppliers for resolution.
	Perform physical inventory counts, cycle counts, and stock checks to ensure accuracy of inventory records and reconcile discrepancies between physical stock and system data.
	Prepare goods for storage or shipment, labeling, tagging, and categorizing items according to storage requirements, product type, and destination.
	Assist in organizing warehouse space, arranging shelves, racks, and storage areas to optimize space utilization, accessibility, and efficiency.
	Pick and pack orders for shipment, selecting items from inventory, assembling orders, and preparing them for dispatch, ensuring accuracy and timeliness of order fulfillment.
	Load and unload trucks, containers, or pallets using manual or powered equipment, such as forklifts, pallet jacks, or hand trucks, following safety procedures and handling guidelines.
	Maintain cleanliness and orderliness of the warehouse, sweeping floors, removing debris, and disposing of waste materials, ensuring compliance with safety and sanitation standards.
	Monitor inventory levels and stock replenishment needs, alerting warehouse manager of low stock levels, overstock situations, or potential stockouts to facilitate timely ordering and replenishment.
	Assist in inventory reconciliation and stock adjustments, documenting inventory movements, adjustments, and transfers in inventory management systems and maintaining accurate records.
	Prepare shipping documents, packing slips, and labels for outgoing shipments, ensuring compliance with shipping regulations, customer requirements, and documentation standards.
	Coordinate with logistics providers, carriers, and freight forwarders to schedule pickups, deliveries, and transportation of goods, tracking shipments and resolving logistics issues as needed.
	Assist in conducting regular safety inspections, equipment checks, and preventive maintenance activities on warehouse equipment, reporting any defects or malfunctions for repair.
	Provide support to warehouse staff and assist in training new hires on warehouse procedures, safety protocols, and equipment operation.
	Follow standard operating procedures (SOPs), work instructions, and company policies governing warehouse operations, ensuring compliance with quality standards and regulatory requirements.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment.asl@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

  "title": "Van Sales Representative",
  "description": "Dynamic Edge Business venture is an arm of Ajoke Group that deals with the distribution of Cadbury products.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Van Sales Representative
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Drive a company-owned van to assigned territories, routes, or customer locations to conduct sales visits and deliveries.
	Load and unload products from the van, ensuring accurate inventory counts and proper handling of goods.
	Establish and maintain relationships with existing and potential customers, addressing their needs and preferences to drive sales.
	Present and demonstrate products or services to customers, highlighting features, benefits, and pricing information.
	Take orders from customers, process sales transactions, and issue receipts or invoices for purchases.
	Negotiate pricing, discounts, and terms with customers to maximize sales revenue and profitability.
	Cross-sell or upsell additional products or services to customers to increase order value and meet sales targets.
	Provide product recommendations, advice, and assistance to customers based on their requirements and preferences.
	Maintain accurate records of sales activities, customer interactions, and inventory levels using sales software or databases.
	Monitor competitor activities, market trends, and customer feedback to identify opportunities and challenges in the sales territory.
	Collaborate with sales managers, supervisors, and colleagues to coordinate sales activities, share insights, and develop strategies.
	Participate in sales meetings, training sessions, and product knowledge sessions to stay updated on company offerings and sales techniques.
	Resolve customer complaints, issues, or concerns in a timely and professional manner, ensuring customer satisfaction and retention.
	Follow safety protocols and driving regulations while operating the company van, ensuring safe transportation of products and personnel.
	Uphold company policies, procedures, and ethical standards in all sales and customer interactions.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an OND / HND / BSc Degree with 1 - 2 years of experience.&nbsp;


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment.asl@yahoo.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Van Sales Representative Job at Dynamic Edge Business Venture




        
    

        
        Dynamic Edge Business venture is an arm of Ajoke Group that deals with the distribution of Cadbury products.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Van Sales Representative
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Drive a company-owned van to assigned territories, routes, or customer locations to conduct sales visits and deliveries.
	Load and unload products from the van, ensuring accurate inventory counts and proper handling of goods.
	Establish and maintain relationships with existing and potential customers, addressing their needs and preferences to drive sales.
	Present and demonstrate products or services to customers, highlighting features, benefits, and pricing information.
	Take orders from customers, process sales transactions, and issue receipts or invoices for purchases.
	Negotiate pricing, discounts, and terms with customers to maximize sales revenue and profitability.
	Cross-sell or upsell additional products or services to customers to increase order value and meet sales targets.
	Provide product recommendations, advice, and assistance to customers based on their requirements and preferences.
	Maintain accurate records of sales activities, customer interactions, and inventory levels using sales software or databases.
	Monitor competitor activities, market trends, and customer feedback to identify opportunities and challenges in the sales territory.
	Collaborate with sales managers, supervisors, and colleagues to coordinate sales activities, share insights, and develop strategies.
	Participate in sales meetings, training sessions, and product knowledge sessions to stay updated on company offerings and sales techniques.
	Resolve customer complaints, issues, or concerns in a timely and professional manner, ensuring customer satisfaction and retention.
	Follow safety protocols and driving regulations while operating the company van, ensuring safe transportation of products and personnel.
	Uphold company policies, procedures, and ethical standards in all sales and customer interactions.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an OND / HND / BSc Degree with 1 - 2 years of experience. 


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment.asl@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
